result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre Nathaniel Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deandre Nathaniel Lee not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing 10/11/2022. States witness is present. Due to the lateness of the hour, the case was not able to be called.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report - 10-11-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-11-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report - 9-20-22

Defendant Deandre Nathaniel Lee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Deandre Nathaniel Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE  for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 9-16-22

Defendant Deandre Nathaniel Lee not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Julius L.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deandre Nathaniel Lee in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Deandre Nathaniel Lee in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deandre Nathaniel Lee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
